content.label: I LOVE this game.  I wouldn‚Äôt say it‚Äôs relaxing all the time, especially with that pesky elder, but I can get in a groove.  It definitely has a learning curve but the levels remind me of ‚Äúwax on, wax off‚Äù (Karate Kid).  I couldn‚Äôt get past the first rock when I started but as I‚Äôve worked on the levels I‚Äôve gradually improved with the controls and have been losing the elder, (well half the time), before I knew it...only to find a second one!  Well, well worth the money and I think this is something I‚Äôll be playing long after I‚Äôve completed all the levels.  Great set up with levels for acclimating players to controls and just a beautiful game.
The game alternates between day and night. When it is nighttime in the game I can't see well enough to play.
Thanks for fixing achievements unlocking every time I ran the app

I used to play Alto‚Äôs Adventure on the iPads at U.S Celluar when I was little, and now that I have a phone, I got it and haven‚Äôt stopped playing! Beautiful game and music, graphics are amazing and interesting! So get the game if you haven‚Äôt!
It‚Äôs just Ski Safari
Game is great, but always seems to crash when I unlock an achievement so I have to repeat the challenge. Want to keep playing but it‚Äôs driving me nuts.
Love the graphics, audio, etc.  Only thing is, I cannot get across the chasm.  Looks like I‚Äôm stuck; and so soon into the game?  What to do?

Beautiful, challenging, and relaxing. The music and gameplay can be a bit repetitive, but for a chill session, it's hard to beat.

@developer team: Every time I open this app, it cycles through my all achievements as if I am receiving them for the first time. I have a to wait a couple of minutes for them to stop.

title.label: One of the best iOS games ever

content.label: These guys get it. Their sequel is even better. Just an incredibly immersive experience that lasts in its novelty for years.

The amount of value you get out of this game is insane. For such a low price you get this simplistic but beautiful game, with a soothing soundtrack and stunning minimalistic visuals. Honestly even if you purchased this game and only played for about 20 minutes I feel like you'd still feel like you got your money's worth because of the beauty of the world. These guys have done great and I hope you support them like I have :)
It‚Äôs phenomenal I love it and I‚Äôm 11,this game is so calming it really doesn‚Äôt matter how much it cost,I went to t mobile and saw the game I played it and I love it.Might as well get the other

This game is one of the most relaxing games I have ever played!I have seen some reviews saying that there were bugs but I haven‚Äôt spotted any.Zen mode was my favorite part of the game.It is just so beautiful and breathtaking.I highly recommend this game.

This game has the best art style of any game I have ever played.  There are fun mechanics and playing only requires one finger.  However, a lot of the challenges take a long time to complete because you are not given the opportunities to complete them very often (eg. catching 3 llamas while hovering).  This makes the gameplay somewhat repetitive and unrewarding.

There are beautiful scenes with peaceful music. I personally love the Zen mode because it has lots of meaning about how you can get back up after you mistakes and the music is tranquilizing. This game is a game of peace and tranquility.

Not actually. For those of you complaining about the wing suit accidentally starting up, turn off 3d touch. It's not random, but if you press too hard on a screen that supports it, you'll activate the wing suit. This makes the experience truly one touch, but a lot of you seem confused about this.

title.label: Excellence dotted with tedium, laced with panic

content.label: Alto‚Äôs Adventure is a lovely endless runner with great art and sound design, satisfying combos, and surprisingly deep interaction between them, wrapped up in a meditation as you descend the mountain slopes on your board. I definitely recommend it if you‚Äôre looking for a way to fill time, especially on a larger screen. Smaller screens can make it even harder to tell which way is up for your snowboarder, which brings me to my first complaint: while the token environment changes are nice, you won‚Äôt be able to see anything when night falls on the mountain. That rock there is almost the exact same colour as the background, that is if you can see both the rock and yourself, either of whom may be hidden behind trees which for some reason are in the foreground and obscure your view as well as being background objects. These snags can contribute to the feeling that the game respects your time less and less as you play and are challenged by harder and harder goals. ‚ÄúSurvive for 2 in-game days straight,‚Äù is so much less satisfying than , ‚Äúcomplete two triple backflips in one run.‚Äù The game also is not at all forgiving of the angle at which you land after being airborne performing these tricks; the number of times I‚Äôve said, ‚Äúliterally any snowboarder who is even approaching the level of skill these characters have would have been able to land at that angle,‚Äù is ever increasing. Though the later goals are certainly guilty of feeling like time consuming treks rather than trick trainers, waiting for the world to generate certain numbers of obstacles so you can actually complete a given goal is also frustrating at times, and lends itself to just repeatedly restarting until three rocks show up right after a backflip or bunting grind. Of course, certain goals are more geared to particular characters you can unlock, though it would have been nice for some of those characters to have a reason to be played other than one or two goals for which they‚Äôre suited or specifically named in. Paz and Izel specifically feel very unremarkable to me. All in all, I love this game, which is why I can bash it a little. It‚Äôs satisfying, artful, and at times, frustrating. It just hasn‚Äôt quite figured out which side of frustratingly satisfying or gradually insultingly difficult it wants to tread yet. Everybody will definitely have fun in the game though, and it‚Äôs worth the money in every way.

Really brought out all the reasons I love winter and skiing more than any season or sport! The beautiful landscapes and calm yet strategic play is the kind of game I love to play every day. It would be even cooler if they could do an update for this game and Alto‚Äôs odyssey on Apple Watch, as easy controls could be simple to use with the crown or touchscreen! I hope you guys consider as Apple Watch as another platform to play on, as one to play on truly anywhere is pretty awesome!

Usually I don‚Äôt leave game and app reviews but Alto‚Äôs Adventure is a genuinely good game. Unfortunately I noticed quite a few bugs when it comes to using Izel. Most of the time, the character is unable to collect coins while using a power up. I also find that many times, running llamas run in the air and not on hills. Besides these little bugs, the game is absolutely amazing!

I‚Äôm not much of a mobile gamer; heck, I‚Äôm not much of a gamer at all. I saw Alto‚Äôs Adventure recommended in a Sam Sheffer video on YouTube just before a trip that included 12 hours on a plane both ways and thought this might be a good purchase for passing the idle hours in the air.

This game blew me away. The easy, intuitive controls, the beautifully simple graphics, the fluid and dynamic gameplay‚Äîall incredible. The challenges scale up in a perfectly linear manner, each level building on the next.

After a few months, I‚Äôve finally spent enough time to beat the game. Yet I still find myself coming back to play for fun. It‚Äôs that good. Overall it‚Äôs without a doubt the best iOS game I‚Äôve ever played. Despite the price, I recommend it without any qualification.
Adventure really says it all
Just bought it yesterday and it‚Äôs already not working.  It either crashes me immediately upon starting or won‚Äôt let me jump at all.  $4.99 and it‚Äôs not worth it.
So well crafted. Beautiful, challenging, creative, fun, captivating. Can‚Äôt say enough good things. It‚Äôs a must have.

It‚Äôs a fun game until you get deeper into it and the challenges become ridiculous and impossible to achieve for anyone normal. Ended up just deleting the app because it was so frustrating. I think if you pay 5$ for an iPhone game you shouldn‚Äôt have to do 41 levels just to get a decent avatar.

It game is awesome except at any time the game doesn‚Äôt receive that I‚Äôm taping. I can pause it I can do everything except for jump backflip or anything. It‚Äôs not a problem with my phone it‚Äôs the game that glitching. Perfect except for this! Please fix this I had come so close to beating rly hard levels. Thanks! 

Update: it‚Äôs getting worse :/

I don‚Äôt know why people would give this game a bad review. I‚Äôve had Alto‚Äôs adventure for almost 3 and a half years and have a high score of 645,823, and it‚Äôs still not boring. The challenges are not hard, but not easy at the same time. It‚Äôs a great game props to Snowman for this.

I have had such a great time with this very meditative, addictive simple little game. Until level 19 when I got an objective that is incredibly frustrating. Ive been on this one objective 3 to 4 times longer than I‚Äôve spent in the previous 18 levels total. Hopefully it gets fun again after that! Never the less, a great, fun game.

Let me just add my glowing review to all the others. This is the most unique app game I have ever played. It‚Äôs just lovely. It‚Äôs exciting at times yet always serene. I was already planning on a five star review, and that was before I realized there is a Zen mode. It was also before I realized you can upgrade and buy things with your coins to help you get through the quests a bit easier. The music is absolutely perfect for this game. It‚Äôs also easy to play and figure out, but the quests get progressively more difficult without being overwhelming or frustrating. Zen mode is so nice if you just want to zone out peacefully for a few minutes. This is a game that I will come back to again and again!

I‚Äôm at level 19 and loved this app UNTIL Alto stopped jumping!  I‚Äôve updated, tried pausing, restarting, everything I can think of, but Alto won‚Äôt jump and so I can‚Äôt use the app anymore.  DEVELOPERS, PLEASE FIX and I‚Äôll rerate this to five stars, because that‚Äôs what is deserved until it stopped working.

This game has been an OG for me. I used to come home from school and let the game and the music fill my head with joy. This app is absolutely worth the money. No ads, no irl purchases. It‚Äôs just a fantastic app. 111/100
I cried playing this game..... I CRIED..... I sat on the toilet soo long ..... legs went numb .... and I was CRYING !!!! Because the game is THAT beautiful

Overall this is one of the best games I've ever played on iPhone. There's only one bug that irritates me everytime I open this app. It starts showing all the achievments that I have already unlocked. Please fix this bug and I'll rate solid 5 stars. 4 stars until then...
This is a 5 star game.... so why the 2 star level Game Center popping up all my achievements while I try to play???

I would give this 5 stars, because I really love this game.
But there is a serious glitch!
My brother and I both play on different devices, so we want to both keep different progress. But we can‚Äôt!
The first time, I didn‚Äôt notice iCloud was on. The second time, it turned back on. I noticed in settings.
The third time, it continued. I turned off iCloud on both devices, but it still auto turned on. I checked settings before leaving, and it said off. Then I went back, and it was on!
I have had to reset my progress many times now, and it is really annoying. Please fix this!!!!!

This game is sooo calming so pretty so just so I can‚Äôt even!! This game deserves wayyyy more than 5 stars! I WILL cure your anxiety! I mean like wow! When I first played it I was all like ok ,ok. But now when I come home I want to play this game because it washes away all of my stress. I decently recommend it and if you don‚Äôt like it, your wrong :) also  when it gets more challenging I play on the ummmmm, zen mode

I love this game, one of my favorites, but lately I've encountered a very annoying bug that's difficult to ignore. Every time I open the app, it displays all of my game center achievements, one by one, at the top of the screen. If this bug were fixed this would be a five star review for sure!

title.label: Thought it was going to be chill

content.label: But all I do is run into rocks

From the graphics to the game play, this game is the most freaking amazing game!, I can‚Äôt even.... And it is actually a game that you don‚Äôt get tired of, I can play this all Day. So if you‚Äôre looking for a game that will blow your mind get Alto‚Äôs Adventure! And if In some possible way you tired of it get Alto‚Äôs Odyssey
I love this game but how do you land a triple backflip???

title.label: It‚Äôs impossible to get past level 20

content.label: There is no way to complete 2 triple backflips in one run. It‚Äôs GD impossible.

title.label: Love the game, but Game Center pop ups annoying

content.label:
I‚Äôve been playing this game for a while now, but either the most recent update or my iPhone XS has introduced an annoying bug. 

Every single time the game launches, the game feels the need to pop up ever single Game Center achievement I have received, and many don‚Äôt show up until after you start a run, causing them to get in the way of my view and have on numerous occasions caused me to crash (especially the flight suit achievement).

Otherwise, I love the game!

title.label: Great Game- just need a bug fixed

content.label: I enjoy this game a lot. This game has lasted the longest without me getting bored and deleting it. There is a bug with the Game Center achievements. Achievements that I have already earned pop up all at once when I open up the app. When you have played the game as long as I have it takes a while for them to disappear.

Best $4.99 ever spent on a game app. Played this game with my Boise canceling headphones. It was one of the most relaxing and immersive experiences ever. The game is worth every penny. I‚Äôve played similar snowboarding/skiiig games and figured it was the same but this totally blew me away. Highly recommend getting it!
Dats one big hill
First I bet fortnite makes more money and oh wait it‚Äôs free

Great game overall but, like with some other reviewers, once you get stuck on something, there is just no way to move on and the game becomes frustrating, repetitive, and boring. You should be able to skip to the next level after giving it a fair go.

I'm still a newbie but I absolutely love this game! It's so relaxing & the graphics are beautiful! One thing though I have reached level 16 & have completed all the goals ~ including the land a combo of 3 backward flips ~ I have done this miraculous task more than a dozen times & it hasn't registered on the tally board. Please help developers ~ I still love this game even with this glitch!!! üíóüôèüèºüíó

I finally got around to paying for this game. I had the free one downloaded on my old phone and it was my favorite game. Such a great art style, calming music, just a great game all around. However, I can‚Äôt give it 5 stars. I finally bit the bullet and paid $4.99 for a game I once got for free and just my luck.. I can‚Äôt get the thing to start up. I updated my phone and made sure the game didn‚Äôt need an update, still when I click on it, it goes to a black screen and stays on there for as long as the game is open. I can‚Äôt even play the game I paid for :(
I still have not made it to wing suit but I don't know why everyone is hating down on the game try to enjoy it more.

title.label: So great! Beautiful, fun and all around amazing!!
